opposite_reasoning: Entity provides the strongest and most principled opposition for WebDocumentAttribute. The Attribute↔Entity distinction is a fundamental ontological category difference in SUMO that creates clear semantic separation. This opposition is: (1) well-established in formal ontology, (2) guaranteed to exist in both WordNet and SUMO with high coverage, (3) provides maximum distributional distance for Fisher-LDA centroid separation, and (4) captures the essential distinction between properties/descriptors (attributes) and the things themselves (entities). While PhysicalAttribute offers abstract↔physical opposition, Entity provides broader coverage and more robust steering utility since it contrasts the nature of 'describing' vs. 'being'.
